what: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
title: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
text: repository hosts code, data supporting analysis “Time essence: effectiveness dairy farm control H5N1 limited fast spread.” analysis structured form R package facilitate reproducibility.

title: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
text: can install development version rRsurveillance GitHub :

title: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
text: primary analysis scripts available : - R/generate_outbreak_chart.R contains code used generate Figure 1, figure ongoing H5N1 outbreak (available manuscript/figures/outbreak.pdf) - manuscript/delay_strategy.qmd contains code generate Figure 2, panel assembles figures make Figure 2. - manuscript/intervention-effectiveness.R contains code generate figures shown Figure 3 panels -C shows effectiveness surveillance strategy detection threshold prevent infections. - manuscript/time--effective-strategy.R contains code generate time required realize effective strategy. values used generate Figure 3 panels D-F. - dev/test-asymptomatic.R contains code explore role asymptomatic transmission detection prevention outbreak generates data Figure 4A - dev/asymptomatic-test.R contains code explore contribution asymptomatic transmission delay terms relative risk also generated complted Figure 4 panels B-C. - dev/conceptual.R contains code generate outputs used make conceptual figures shown Figure 5. - Supplmental analysis: - dev/test-mortality.R contains code explore role disease induced mortality detection prevention outbreak. Please note R scripts run across 38 threads single node Wake Forest University HPC took ~5-6hrs. Running scripts single machine may take significantly long time.

title: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
text: parameterized analysis R package faciliate ease use allow us explore scenarios speed surveillance intervention strategies. run_det_ode contains code used run deterministic compartmental model described manuscript. code use deSolve package solve differential equations. Additionally, code adds milk production. detect_infections_ode processes outputs run_det_ode find particular detection threshold met (e.g., number cows infected cumulatively, number symptomatic cows clinical signs, proportion drop milk production). function returns list object timepoint detection threshold met. run_intervention_ode allows given intervention applied given detection surveillance approach (e.g., number symptomatic detected) time delay varying intensity.

title: Understanding the role of speed on containing outbreaks on dairy farms.
text: reminder, ODE shown : dSdt=−βSI/NdIdt=βSI/N−γIdBdt=γI−κBdRdt=κB \begin{align}   \frac{dS}{dt} &= - \beta S /N \\   \frac{dI}{dt} &= \beta S /N - \gamma \\   \frac{dB}{dt} &= \gamma - \kappa B \\   \frac{dR}{dt} &= \kappa B \\ \end{align} Milk production calculated follows: Milk=100*(S+)+75*B+80*R \text{Milk} = 100 * (S + ) + 75 * B + 80 * R

Run ODE — run_det_ode
text: Run ordinary differential equation model

title: Run ODE — run_det_ode
code: run_det_ode(   init.inf = 1,   herd.size = 500,   r0 = 1.2,   fever.duration = 1.15,   milk.loss.dur = 7,   cow.prod.lifespan = 365.25 * 2,   include.prod.lifespan = FALSE,   base.milk.prod = 100,   sympt.milk.prod = 100 - 25,   recovered.milk.prod = 80,   discard.sick.prod = FALSE,   disease.induced.mortality = 0,   prop.cull = 0,   sim.length = 365,   gamma_multiplier = 0,   beta_multiplier = 0,   intervention_date = NULL,   intervention_stop = sim.length,   p_asymptomatic = 0,   sigmoid_fun = FALSE,   add_milk = TRUE )

title: Run ODE — run_det_ode
text: init.inf integer, number initial infection herd.size integer, size herd r0 positive number, basic reproduction number fever.duration positive number, days fever (infectious) milk.loss.dur positive number, days milk loss cow.prod.lifespan positive number, productive lifespan cow days. include.prod.lifespan logical, background demographics considered default FALSE base.milk.prod positive number, baseline milk production sympt.milk.prod positive number, milk production cow symptomatic recovered.milk.prod positive number, production among recovered cows. discard.sick.prod logical, discard infected milk production disease.induced.mortality positive number 0 1 representing mortality rate disease. prop.cull positive number 0 1 representing proportion cows recover infection sent market sim.length positive number, number days run simulation gamma_multiplier number, representing impact recovery rate values greater 0 represent faster removal values less 0 represent longer recovery times. beta_multiplier number, represent impact contact rate rate values less 0 indicate less contact values greater 0 indicate contact. intervention_date positive number represent day number intervention default NULL representing intervention taking place. intervention_stop positive number representing day intervention beta_multiple stops. Removal rates assumed continue intervention stop dates. p_asymptomatic number 0 1, proportion transmission asymptomatic. sigmoid_fun logical, true sigmoid function utilized phase gamma mulipltier based intervention date. add_milk logical, true milk production added simulation.

title: Run odin vaccine — run_odin_vaccines
text: intervention_time interger number representing intervention occurs n_sims integer number simulation r0 number representing basic reproduction number gamma_in number recovery rate period infectiousness kappa_in number, rate transition B zeta_in number, vaccination rate S R duration integer representing duration simulation s_initial number, initial population size i_initial number, initial number infected inter_scenario different scenarios n_detected interger, using second intervention threshold
